text: Simply delicious, all in one. Tender bits of mutton in fragrant briyani, starchy yellow dhal, a sharp kick of sour rasam, and the satisfying bite of fried chicken with the bone in. Add a boiled egg and the crackle of fresh pappadum, and you‚Äôve got the perfect meal. From across NTU, I walk the 20 minutes‚Äîit‚Äôs my way of earning the food and making it a healthy ritual. A warm, comforting break from the stress of traffic and daily grind. Hearty, affordable, and packed with flavor‚Äîjust the recharge I need.
Only the bakuteh and braised rice stall is popular, the rest I have not tried yet. Meat a bit hard but we'll cooked and reasonable price

Big airy place, windy area.
Lots of food option.

Gone for zichar.
Not sure why the big sis rush like no tomorrow when the place is empty at that time. We thought they closed early but no.

Here what we had. Starting from the best.
Garlic Butter Clam(S)($12)üòã - Creamy & saucey with full of buttery & garlicky taste.  Lala were fresh but did not rinse it properly.

Fu Yong Omelette(M)($8)üëå-  Fluffy omelette with a light crisp & is not very oily at all.

Sweet & Sour Pork(S)($12)üòê - Chewy tender but floury meat in sweet & sour sauce. Looks great but the taste weird.
Huge coffeeshop with a wide variety of stalls! The Mala Xiang Guo Taste fragrant! But more to the costlier side though because their Chinese kebab are also on a little higher price ~

Good place to enjoy Ipoh authentic food.
Really delicious.
